channel.title: math.GM updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.GM updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On the sum of reciprocals of primes
item.description: arXiv:2403.04768v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: For $y>0$ and $0<K<1$, let $P^+$ be the set of primes $p$ such that $\cos(y\ln p)>K$ and $P^-$ the set of primes $p$ such that $\cos(y\ln p)<-K$ . In this paper we prove $\sum_{p\in P^+}\frac{1}{p}=\infty$ and $\sum_{p\in P^-}\frac{1}{p}=\infty$.
item.dc:creator: Young Deuk Kim

item.title: A note on Cardano's formula
item.description: arXiv:2403.04774v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: In this paper we show that Cardanos formula for the solution of cubic equations can be reduced to expressions involving only square roots if the real root is rational.
item.dc:creator: Dietmar Pfeifer

item.title: Denesting cubic radicals
item.description: arXiv:2403.04776v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: We study in details how and when the radical $\sqrt[3]{a+b\sqrt p}$ with rational numbers $a,b$ and $p$ positive can be simplified, providing a complete answer to the problem; furthermore, a program that computes the result is also made available. The solution highlights an interesting connection with the cubic formula.
item.dc:creator: Alberto Cavallo

item.title: Attempting to Prove the Riemann Hypothesis through the Reflection Formula
item.description: arXiv:2403.05347v1 Announce Type: new Abstract: The Riemann Hypothesis, originally proposed by the eminent mathematician Bernard Riemann in 1859, remains one of the most profound challenges in number theory. It posits that all non-trivial zeros of the Riemann zeta function {\zeta}(s) are concentrated precisely along the critical line where the real part equals 1/2. In this paper, our aim is to present an attempt to prove this conjecture. Our approach relies on the use of the reflection formula. By applying this tool with precision and insight, we can conclusively establish that {\xi}(s)^2 (Riemann's {\xi}-function) is valid only when Re(s)=1/2. As a direct consequence of this determination, we can assert that every zero of both {\xi}(s)^2 and {\xi}(s) has a real part equal to 1/2. This, in turn, leads us to the tentative conclusion that the real part of all non-trivial zeros of the zeta function is consistently 1/2.
item.dc:creator: Farid Kenas

item.title: Deformed Newton's $(s,t)$-Binomial Series and Generating Functions of Generalized Fibonomial Coefficients
item.description: arXiv:2306.07431v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: We define the deformed $(s,t)$-binomial formula and the deformed Newton $(s,t)$-binomial series and we will use it to establish the generating functions of generalized simplicial polytopic numbers, generalized central binomial coefficients, and the generalized Catalan numbers. Furthermore, analogues of the Lehmer series are introduced.
item.dc:creator: Ronald Orozco L\'opez
